definition: no stronghold one cannot overcome (idiom); to conquer every obstacle/nothing one can't do/to carry everything before one
to break/to destroy/to devastate/to ravage/to repress

sentences.english: He is Chinese edition applies Waxinge, all-conquering.
sentences.chinese: 他是中國版施瓦辛格，無堅不摧。

sentences.english: We just know that he is using an invincible golden gun.
sentences.chinese: 我們只知道他用的是一枝無堅不摧的金槍。

sentences.english: In the term of history, the power of culture is unrivaled .
sentences.chinese: 從世界歷史上看，文化的力量無堅不摧。

sentences.english: Lyon won and with three victories in three games they confirm that they are a solid and strong team.
sentences.chinese: 里昂三戰三勝，顯示了他們無堅不摧的強大實力。

sentences.english: As for violence, she hated it—until she became hardened.
sentences.chinese: 她痛恨暴力，直到她變得無堅不摧。

definition: frigid irony and scorching satire (idiom); to mock and ridicule
vocal accompaniment in some traditional Chinese operas/to speak in support of/to chime in
dumbstruck and unable to reply (idiom); left speechless/at a loss for words
display of severity immediately on taking office/(fig.) initial show of strength
lit. impervious to sword or spear (idiom)/fig. invulnerable/untouchable/thick-skinned/impervious to criticism
to rack one's brains for schemes (idiom)/to beat one's brains out
to bare fangs and brandish claws (idiom); to make threatening gestures
to keep on saying (idiom); to repeat over and over again
